actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend section 1951, title 18, United States Code, act of July 3, 1946.

summary.text: Hobbs Act Amendment - Provides that whoever obstructs or interferes with commerce by willfully damaging, burning, or injuring to the extent of $25,000 or more any real, personal, or mixed property of an employer, owner or other person at or near a factory, construction site, or any other place where work or business of the employer is carried on shall be fined not more than $10,000 or imprisoned not more than 20 years, or both. (Amends 18 U.S.C. 1951)

titles.title: A bill to amend section 1951, title 18, United States Code, act of July 3, 1946.
